Posts.Content: 40 y/o male presenting with hematospermia/anal pain. 12/17 Psa-2.90, 1/17 Psa-2.40. I just received the results from ExoDX Prostate Intelliscore and they are 51.71, with a cut off of 15.6. Thus, agressive Pca Gleason 7 or higher. Any one else have this test and have similar results with a negative biopsy? My uro is not dismissing, however he has stated that my psa should be higher? Thoughts?
Posts.Title: Validity of ExoDX Prostate Intelliscore

Posts.Content: I am still waiting for an MpMRI approval. However, I just had a repeat psa and it is down to 2.2 ng/ml. My uro said that he wants to perform a biopsy. What are the thoughts here in regard to my ExoDX score, and high grade Pca?
Posts.Title: Validity of ExoDX Prostate Intelliscore

Posts.Content: Thank you for your insight. Thank you again, I will keep the forum posted.
Posts.Title: New Psa results 2.40 from 2.90

Posts.Content: Yes, I had a CT urogram a year ago. My prostate measured 31cc with mild prostatic hypertrophy and calcification.
Posts.Title: PCA or prostatitis at age 40?

Posts.Content: For the past month, I have been having hematospermia, watery ejaculate, urinary urgency, and incontinence. My PSA in 8/16 was 1.5, while a current PSA (12/17) is 2.9. I also have low T at 391 ng/dl for 40 years of age. I had a previous FISH showing four cells with polysomy for chromosomes 3,7,9,17, however my bladder work-up with a CXbladder and cysto was negative. Based upon my symptoms, would you be of the opinion that I have aggressive PCA (per low T), or prostatitis? Also, would you recommend a PCA 3 urine biomarker? Pplexed
Posts.Title: PCA or prostatitis at age 40?

Posts.Content: Thank you sir. I have read your numerous posts, and you are a voice of knowledge, and inspiration. The next step needs to be a biopsy. The only concern are negative findings. My exoDX score, PSA, and free psa point to the likelihood of a malignancy.
Posts.Title: 41 with a PIRADS-2/ PSA 3.5 14% free, and a ExoDx score of 51.71=High Grade Cancer?

Posts.Content: Thank you sir. I have read your numerous posts, and you are a voice of knowledge, and inspiration. The next step needs to be a biopsy. The only concern are negative findings. My exoDX score, PSA, and free psa point to the likelihood of a malignancy.
Posts.Title: 41 with a PIRADS-2/ PSA 3.5 14% free, and a ExoDx score of 51.71=High Grade Cancer?

Posts.Content: I am a 41 year old male. My psa history is as follows: 07/12-1.27, 12/17-2.90, 1/17-2.40. 2/18-1.90, 2/19-3.50 (Free 0.49) percentage 14%.. My ExoDX Prostate Intelliscore-51.71-2/18. I had an MP-MRI at Johns Hopkins in April 04/18 which showed no lesion, and two areas identified as possible Prostatitis with a PIRADS score of 2. However, my current PSA as of yesterday is 3.5 with a free PSA of 0.49, and a percentage at 14%, is quite concerning for agressive PCA at 41 years of age. I do not have any symptoms indicating a prostate infection. What are the forums thoughts?
Posts.Title: 41 with a PIRADS-2/ PSA 3.5 14% free, and a ExoDx score of 51.71=High Grade Cancer?

Posts.Content: My physician has advised that an MRI fusion biopsy is best. He has discussed trying to repeat the MPMRI, however feels per the current elevation a biopsy is best.
